p.s: The given excerpt from William Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice deals with the jewishJewish moneylender Shylock and his jewishJewish friend Tubal.
Tubal has been trying to find Shylock's daughter Jessica who ran away with a Christian man.
After Tubal confesses that he was not able to find Shylock's daughter, Shylock strats grieving for his lost fortunes that Jessica took with her.
He is frustrated because he will not get revenge and has to pay lots of money for the search, so he wishes that his daughter was dead.
Shylock is cheered up when Tubal tells him that Antonio will probably be alte to pay.
Antonio is a Christian man that lend 3000 ducats from Shylock.
He did this for his best friend Bossanio so he could meet Portia, who he wishes to marry.
In the past Antonio has insulted and spat on Shylock, just because he is jewishJewish.

Shylock hates Antonio for his anti-semetic behaviour on one condition and agreed to lend him the ducats interest-free on one condition: Ifif Antonio is late to pay the money back, he owes Shylock a pound of his own flesh.
Shylock is excited now because Antonio will have to stay true to his word.
When Tubal mentions how much money Jessica has spent, Shylock's mood quickly changes to anger.
But when talking about a specific ring that Jessica exchanged for a monkey it becomes clear that this ring was of great importance for Shylock since he had gotten it from his dead wife Leah.
But soon he is distracted by Antonio's approaching bankruptcy and Shylock sends Tubal to hire an officer to get Antonio arrested.
All in all, Shylock is mourning for his lost fortunes.
He is told about Antonio being late, leading to him being excited to get Antonio's flesh.
